title: Was the Edwardian era really a 'golden era'? - Quora

response.answer_text: 1901–1910- was the last era when aristocrats were aristocrats and could run big houses. But the movement for rights was gaining momentum so this was a last gasp. Servants were getting rarer. Clothes were becoming standardized for rich and poor, women could work and were pushing for the vote. Still half the working laborers lived in poverty. World War I is commonly regarded as the end of the old aristocratic system.
For those with money and property it was. For most of the UK it was not.
